sn22.33:1: At Sāvatthī. "Bhikkhus, whatever is not yours, abandon it. When you have abandoned it, that will lead to your welfare and happiness.[n.46] The parallel atMN I 40,33–4,9includesdīgharattaṁ,"for a long time";SN35.0also omits this.Spksays that form and the other aggregates are abandoned by the abandoning of desire and lust, confirmed bySN22.25andSN22..And what is it, bhikkhus, that is not yours? Form is not yours: abandon it. When you have abandoned it, that will lead to your welfare and happiness. Feeling is not yours … Perception is not yours …sn.iii.34Volitional formations are not yours … Consciousness is not yours: abandon it. When you have abandoned it, that will lead to your welfare and happiness.
sn22.33:2: "Suppose, bhikkhus, people were to carry off the grass, sticks, branches, and foliage in this Jeta's Grove, or to burn them, or to do with them as they wish. Would you think: ‘People are carrying us off, or burning us, or doing with us as they wish’?"
